metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3672 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The qemu implementation in libvirt before 1.3.0 and Xen allows local guest OS users to cause a denial of service (host disk consumption) by writing to stdout or stderr.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2017-08-01, no equivalent fix in qemu tree. Unlikely to be fixed in qemu. As such, marking as ignored in qemu.  the libvirt fix changes behaviour, we are not going to backport the new log location to trusty.

criterions.comment: libvirt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.6').
